cab.content: General Staff,War Office, 3,1.1. 21st September, 1918. Issued at 6.45 p.m.BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING 81st SEPTEMBER, 1918, I' WESTERN FRONT. . -British-,-East of EPEHY the situation is obscure after a strong counter-attack by the enemy, French.Nothing to report.2' MACEDONIAN FRONT.'The Serbians have-"continued, their advance, and ih^ir infan-tryaueon the line KRNfi&VO' - STRIGOVO - DRAGOJIL - -POLSSHKOv Their cavalry has pushed forward in front of this line and has captured a complete group of field artillery with ammunition near KAVADAR.3. PALESTINE FRONT. 'Our cavalry have reached.EL AFULE, 7 miles South of NAZARETH r. The Turks "have1 abandoned large quantities of stores and mechanical transport.No operations wire has been received to-day from Egypt;.,4c ITALIAN FRONT.Nothing to report.
